item.title: Delhi News LIVE Updates: CAQM invokes GRAP 3 restrictions in Delhi-NCR - The Indian Express
item.description:
CAQM Implements GRAP 3 Restrictions Amid Poor Air Quality in Delhi-NCR

Date: Friday

Source: Indian Express

The Centre’s Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) invoked the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) under Stage III in the Delhi-NCR region due to continuous poor air quality.

  • The air quality index has remained in the ‘very poor’ category for four consecutive days.
  • Restrictions include a hybrid mode for classes up to V and a ban on certain vehicles.
  • There are staggered timings for public offices and a ban on demolition and construction activities.
  • Political tensions rise as AAP accuses BJP of neglecting law and order issues.
“There is an aapda in Delhi — that of law and order. Gangsters are shooting in the open.” - Arvind Kejriwal

The situation in Delhi highlights ongoing air quality concerns alongside rising political tensions between parties.

item.title: 'Compulsive hostility towards India': MEA slams US news reports on Maldives, warns Pakistan of 'snakes in - The Times of India
item.description:
'Compulsive Hostility towards India': MEA Responds to US Reports on Maldives and Issues Warning to Pakistan

Publication Date: 2023-10-17 Source: Times of India

India's Ministry of External Affairs has criticized US media narratives regarding the Maldives and has issued a stern warning to Pakistan about its regional actions.

  • The MEA condemned what it termed 'compulsive hostility' towards India in certain US reports.
  • Pakistan was warned of 'snakes in the backyard', emphasizing the need for regional stability.
  • The statements come in light of increasing tensions in South Asia and concerns over external influences in local affairs.
'Maintaining regional integrity is paramount. All nations must be mindful of the historical contexts and current realities.' - MEA Spokesperson

In conclusion, the MEA's statements highlight India's focus on safeguarding its interests in the face of international narratives and regional challenges.

item.title: Budget 2025: Income Tax Cut Likely; Know Current Rates, Slabs Under New Tax Regime Vs Old Tax Regime - News18
item.description:
Budget 2025: Income Tax Cut Likely; Know Current Rates, Slabs Under New Tax Regime Vs Old Tax Regime

Last Updated: January 03, 2025, 18:42 IST

As India prepares for the Union Budget 2025-26 announcement, income tax changes are highly anticipated, particularly potential reductions for earners up to Rs 15 lakh annually.

Key Points:

  • The New Tax Regime offers lower rates without exemptions and deductions.
  • The Old Tax Regime allows for various exemptions and deductions for higher tax rates.
  • Current tax slabs under the New Regime range from nil for income up to Rs 3 lakh to 30% for income above Rs 15 lakh.
  • The Old Regime starts with nil for income up to Rs 2.5 lakh and also has a slab for senior citizens with a higher exemption limit.
  • Expectations include possible hikes in basic exemption limits to support middle-income groups.
“From a perspective of boosting consumption, we have suggested that there be some relief provided to income tax up to a Rs 20 lakh on the marginal income tax rate...” - Sanjiv Puri, CII Chairman

The upcoming budget may introduce changes in tax structures that could promote economic buoyancy and provide incentives for lower-income earners.

item.title: India lodges protest with China over announcement on two new counties in Hotan prefecture, says MEA - The Hindu
item.description:
India Protests China's Creation of Two New Counties in Hotan Prefecture

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

India has formally protested China's recent establishment of two new counties in Hotan prefecture, reaffirming that such actions do not challenge India's sovereignty over the area.

  • On January 3, 2024, India lodged a protest with China regarding the creation of new counties.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs emphasized that this action does not legitimize China's illegal occupation of Indian territory.
  • Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal reiterated India's longstanding position on sovereignty and the illegality of China's occupation.
  • India is also monitoring the situation concerning other geopolitical issues, such as the sentencing of Ms. Nimisha Priya in Yemen.
“Creation of new counties will neither have a bearing on India’s long-standing and consistent position regarding our sovereignty over the area nor lend legitimacy to China’s illegal and forcible occupation.” - Randhir Jaiswal

This protest highlights the ongoing tensions between India and China regarding territorial disputes and sovereignty issues.

item.title: India Protests China's New "Counties", Parts Of Which Are In Ladakh - NDTV
item.description:
India Protests China's New Counties in Ladakh Region

Date: Recent Source: New Delhi

India has formally protested to China regarding the establishment of two new counties in Xinjiang, parts of which are claimed by India's Union Territory of Ladakh. The Ministry of External Affairs emphasized India's stance against illegal Chinese occupation.

  • China announced the creation of He'an County and Hekang County, both under Hotan Prefecture.
  • The Indian government firmly opposes these counties, emphasizing that such actions do not legitimize Chinese claims.
  • India raised concerns over a Chinese hydropower project on the Brahmaputra, asserting its rights as a lower riparian state.
“We have never accepted the illegal Chinese occupation of Indian territory in this area.” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

This diplomatic conflict highlights ongoing tensions in the region regarding territorial claims and water management issues.

item.title: CBI Doesn't Need State Govt's Consent To Register FIR Under Central Law Against Central Govt Employee... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Rules CBI Can Register FIRs Against Central Employees Without State Consent

Date: December 2, 2023 Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court affirmed that the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is not required to seek consent from state governments to register FIRs against central government employees working in that state regarding corruption allegations.

  • The Court addressed two FIRs filed under the Prevention of Corruption Act against central government employees in Andhra Pradesh.
  • The Andhra Pradesh High Court had initially ruled that state consent was necessary due to the bifurcation of Andhra Pradesh.
  • The Supreme Court overturned this ruling, emphasizing that general consent given under the Delhi Special Police Establishment Act remains valid.
  • The Court reaffirmed its stance from previous cases regarding the necessity of consent for CBI investigations across state lines.
“Therefore, the question is in such circumstances merely because such an employee works within the territory of a particular State, to register an FIR by the CBI in connection with commission of an offence under a Central Act whether consent from the State Government concerned is required or not?”

This ruling clarifies the extent of the CBI's authority and the interpretation of consent under central laws, ensuring streamlined investigations into corruption without state hindrances.

item.title: ‘A Parsi, a Muslim, a Sikh, a Hindu’: Amitabh Bachchan pays tribute to Indian icons in heaven with sweet post - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Amitabh Bachchan Pays Tribute to Indian Icons

Publication Date: Jan 03, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Amitabh Bachchan honors the memory of significant Indian figures lost in 2024 through a heartfelt portrayal by cartoonist Satish Acharya.

  • Bachchan shared a post on social media remembering icons like Ratan Tata, Zakir Hussain, Manmohan Singh, and Shyam Benegal.
  • The artwork depicts them enjoying their passions in the afterlife, emphasizing unity among different communities.
  • The caption read: “A Parsi, a Muslim, a Sikh, and a Hindu passed away in 2024 and the whole nation mourned and remembered them only as Indians.”
The picture says it all.

This tribute underscores the importance of unity and remembrance of those who contributed greatly to society.

item.title: Shiv Sena (UBT)'s rare praise for Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis: ‘Deva Bhau…’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shiv Sena (UBT)'s rare praise for Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis: ‘Deva Bhau…’

Date: January 03, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Shiv Sena (UBT) has praised Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis for his efforts to develop the Naxal-affected Gadchiroli district, marking a rare instance of commendation from a party historically at odds with him.

  • Devendra Fadnavis visited Gadchiroli on New Year's Eve, starting what the Shiv Sena (UBT) described as a 'chapter of development.'
  • During his visit, Fadnavis noted significant infrastructure improvements, including road and bridge constructions.
  • 11 Naxalites surrendered to police, showcasing a potential shift in the area's security dynamics.
  • The Shiv Sena (UBT) expressed hope for positive changes in tribal lives due to Fadnavis' initiatives.
  • Despite praising Fadnavis, the Shiv Sena (UBT) emphasizes the need for him to translate plans into concrete results.
“Fadnavis has to translate the roadmap into reality,” stated the Shiv Sena (UBT) in their editorial.

Overall, the commendation from the Shiv Sena (UBT) indicates a potential shift in political relations in Maharashtra, especially considering previous tensions between the parties.

item.title: Video: Navy Officers Fall In Beach After Parachute Mix-Up In Andhra Pradesh - News18
item.description:
Navy Officers Face Close Call During Parachute Training in Visakhapatnam

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Two Indian Navy officers experienced a dangerous incident during a training exercise when their parachutes became entangled, causing them to fall into the water at Rama Krishna beach in Visakhapatnam.

  • The incident occurred during a rehearsal for an operational demonstration scheduled for January 4.
  • Both officers managed to reach shore safely with no injuries reported.
  • A video captured the moment when the officers were in free fall with one carrying the national flag.
  • Rescue boats were promptly on the scene to assist the officers after the fall.
The Indian Navy MARCOS are fine. They did not collide; instead, the parachutes had become entangled. The rescue boats were nearby and reached the location where they had fallen. — Akash Sharma (@kaidensharmaa) January 3, 2025

The upcoming demonstration will showcase the Indian Navy's capabilities, with various activities planned.

item.title: Scottish hiker detained in New Delhi over use of Garmin inReach: What is this GPS device? - Firstpost
item.description:
Scottish Hiker Detained in New Delhi for Banned Garmin GPS Device

Date & Source: January 3, 2025 - Firstpost

A Scottish hiker named Heather was detained at Delhi airport for carrying a Garmin inReach GPS device, which is prohibited in India. She has shared her experience on Instagram, warning others against bringing such devices into the country.

  • Heather was detained at Indira Gandhi International Airport while attempting to travel to Rishikesh.
  • The Garmin inReach device is banned in India along with in 13 other countries.
  • Heather described her experience and the lengthy police questioning on her Instagram account.
  • She was held for several hours and informed she would need to make a court appearance.
  • The prohibition on satellite communication devices is rooted in historical regulations aimed at preventing security risks.
  • Recent similar incidents involved a Canadian woman and a Czech national detained for the same reason.
“I don’t know what the outcome will be. I guess I will just have to wait.” - Heather

The incident raises awareness about the legal implications for travelers carrying devices that could be misused, highlighting the need for caution and knowledge of local laws.

item.title: Bengaluru woman jumps from moving auto after drunk driver takes wrong route, Namma Yatri responds - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bengaluru Woman Jumps from Auto After Drunk Driver Takes Wrong Route

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A 30-year-old woman narrowly escaped harm in Bengaluru after jumping from a moving auto-rickshaw, realizing the driver was intoxicated and veering off course.

  • The woman booked the auto via the Namma Yatri app, traveling from Horamavu to Thanisandra.
  • She discovered the driver was driving erratically and unresponsive to her requests to stop.
  • The driver displayed signs of intoxication, prompting the woman to take action.
  • After jumping from the auto, she refused to get back in when the driver attempted to persuade her.
  • She later shared her experience on social media, highlighting concerns over women’s safety during late-night travel.
“This is a grave issue concerning women’s safety. If this can happen to my wife at 9 PM, imagine how many other women face similar situations while traveling late at night.” - Azhar Khan

The incident has sparked discussions on women's safety in Bengaluru, leading to a response from Namma Yatri offering assistance.

item.title: Caste Discrimination In Colleges : Supreme Court Seeks Data From UGC On Equal Opportunity Cells, Action... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Demands Data on Caste Discrimination in Colleges

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here]

Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Supreme Court has called on the University Grants Commission to provide data regarding the establishment of Equal Opportunity Cells in higher educational institutions following a PIL concerning caste discrimination.

  • The court seeks data from universities along with complaints received and actions taken.
  • Issues raised include the number of universities with Equal Opportunity Cells and their monitoring by the UGC.
  • Concerns were highlighted about caste-based discrimination leading to student suicides.
  • The petition was filed by the mothers of Rohit Vemula and Payal Tadvi, who suffered from caste discrimination.
  • The court emphasized the need for a mechanism to enforce existing regulations aimed at preventing discrimination.
“Ultimately it is in the interest of the students and the parents whose children have lost their lives. In the future, atleast some care should be taken that this doesn't happen.”

This case highlights the pressing need to address caste discrimination in educational institutions to safeguard the rights and lives of students.

item.title: Watch: 2 injured in Pithampur after locals attempt self-immolation during protest against Union Carbide w - The Times of India
item.description:
Watch: 2 injured in Pithampur after locals attempt self-immolation during protest against Union Carbide waste dumping

Publication Date: [Publication Date Not Provided] Source: [Source Not Provided]

In Pithampur, two individuals were injured as locals protested against the dumping of Union Carbide waste, leading to self-immolation attempts.

  • The protest was sparked by ongoing concerns over the unsafe disposal of hazardous waste by Union Carbide.
  • Demonstrators expressed their desperation, leading to extreme measures like self-immolation attempts.
  • The situation highlights community fears regarding environmental safety and health risks associated with waste dumping.
“We cannot endure this any longer, the waste is poisoning our land and water.”

This event underscores the urgent need for responsible waste management in the region and reflects the lengths to which communities will go to protect their environment.

item.title: Laws Applicable To Andhra Pradesh Continue To Apply To New States Of Telangana & AP After Bifurcation :... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Clarifies Continuity of Laws Post Andhra Pradesh and Telangana Bifurcation

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court has clarified that the laws applicable to the erstwhile State of Andhra Pradesh will continue to apply to the newly formed States of Telangana and Andhra Pradesh until altered or repealed. This decision follows a legal challenge regarding the jurisdiction of the CBI in corruption cases.

  • The Supreme Court set aside a prior judgment from the Andhra Pradesh High Court regarding consent for CBI investigations in the newly formed states.
  • The High Court previously ruled that CBI needed consent from Andhra Pradesh for investigations under the Prevention of Corruption Act.
  • The Supreme Court found that no explicit consent was necessary as the accused were Central Government employees.
  • The decision references previous case law regarding the continuity of laws after state bifurcations.
  • This ruling may affect similar jurisdictional issues in other cases involving Central Government employees.
“Finally, the Court framed the question: ‘merely because such an employee works within the territory of a particular State, to register an FIR by the CBI in connection with commission of an offence under a Central Act whether consent from the State Government concerned is required or not?’”

The ruling specifies that the continuity of laws remains effective until legally changed, impacting the operations of various governmental agencies in both states.

item.title: Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Gets Top Court Notice In 2002 Murder Case - NDTV
item.description:
Supreme Court Issues Notice to Dera Chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim in 2002 Murder Case

Date: Today, Source: New Delhi

The Supreme Court has issued a notice to Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh, chief of Dera Sacha Sauda, along with four others in the 2002 murder case of former Dera manager Ranjit Singh, after the CBI challenged the Punjab and Haryana High Court's acquittal.

  • The notice follows the CBI's plea against the acquittal of Ram Rahim and co-accused.
  • The murder occurred on July 10, 2002, related to an anonymous letter alleging sexual exploitation by Ram Rahim.
  • A special CBI court had previously convicted Ram Rahim and four others in 2021, awarding them life imprisonment.
  • In May 2024, the Punjab and Haryana High Court overturned this conviction.
  • Ram Rahim's past convictions include the rape of two women, leading to widespread violence in 2017.
“The CBI court concluded that Ram Rahim orchestrated the murder due to suspicions about Mr. Singh’s involvement in exposing allegations.”

This case highlights the ongoing legal battles involving Gurmeet Ram Rahim and the significant societal implications stemming from his actions.

item.title: Maha Kumbh 2025 after 144 years: The mythology, and historical context of the grand celebration of faith - OpIndia
item.description:
Maha Kumbh 2025: A Historic Religious Gathering After 144 Years

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: OpIndia

The Maha Kumbh, a significant religious and cultural event, will be held in Prayagraj after a gap of 144 years. The event draws countless pilgrims seeking spiritual fulfillment, particularly through the sacred bathing at the confluence of the Ganga, Yamuna, and Saraswati rivers.

  • The Maha Kumbh is celebrated based on astrological alignments, traditionally linked to the beginning of the universe.
  • It is considered the world’s largest religious gathering, reflecting deep-rooted Hindu beliefs and practices.
  • Kumbh Mela sites correspond to locations where drops of Amrit fell during the churning of the ocean according to mythology.
  • Significant historical accounts from Chinese traveler Huen Tsang and texts like the Puranas underscore its enduring relevance.
  • The Kumbh will be marked by rituals conducted at sacred sites, especially the revered Akshayvat tree.
“Taking a bath in Kumbh is considered extremely pious and leads one to the world of Vishnu.”

This rare occurrence allows devotees to take part in a tradition that has evolved over millennia, marking a significant moment in the cultural landscape of India.

item.title: Supreme Court asks Gurmeet Ram Rahim, others to respond to CBI plea against their acquittal in 2002 murder case - The Hindu
item.description:
Supreme Court asks Gurmeet Ram Rahim, others to respond to CBI plea against their acquittal in 2002 murder case

Published on: January 03, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has requested responses from Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh and four others concerning the CBI's appeal against their acquittal in a murder case from 2002.

  • The Supreme Court issued the notices on January 3, 2025.
  • The CBI has appealed against a previous acquittal by the Punjab and Haryana High Court.
  • The acquittal involved the murder of Ranjit Singh, the former manager of Dera Sacha Sauda.
The CBI has challenged the order passed by the Punjab and Haryana High Court on May 28, 2024, acquitting Singh and four others over the murder of the sect's former manager Ranjit Singh.

This case may have significant implications for the individuals involved and for the intersection of law and religious leadership in India.

item.title: Supreme Court Issues Notice On CBI's Challenge To Acquittal Of Ram Rahim Singh In 2002 Ranjit Singh... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Issues Notice On CBI's Challenge To Acquittal Of Ram Rahim Singh In 2002 Ranjit Singh Case

Date: January 3, 2024 Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has issued a notice regarding the Central Bureau of Investigation's (CBI) plea to challenge the acquittal of Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh in the 2002 murder case of manager Ranjit Singh.

  • The Supreme Court's bench, comprising CJI Sanjiv Khanna and Justice Sanjay Kumar, is now hearing the case.
  • Ranjit Singh was murdered in 2002, allegedly due to suspicions linked to Baba Ram Rahim regarding an anonymous letter that exposed sexual exploitation issues.
  • The CBI failed to establish a clear motive for the murder, according to an earlier High Court ruling.
  • Ram Rahim Singh is currently serving a 20-year sentence for rape and is also convicted for another murder.
“The prosecution case was ‘shrouded in doubts’.” - Statement from the High Court ruling

This case highlights significant legal proceedings involving high-profile convictions and the ongoing discussions around justice in the context of powerful figures.

item.title: Alcohol, blades & a confession video, how father-son duo 'planned & packaged' murder of mother, sisters - ThePrint
item.description:
Father-Son Duo Planned and Executed Murder of Mother and Sisters in Uttar Pradesh

Date & Source: Published on 1st January 2025, The Print

Introduction: A chilling murder case has come to light in Uttar Pradesh, India, where a 24-year-old man, Mohammed Arshad, along with his father, Mohammed Badar, allegedly planned and executed the murder of Arshad's mother and four sisters, two of whom were minors.

  1. The victims were strangled and their wrists were slit on the night of 31 December and 1 January.
  2. The bodies were recovered from a hotel in Lucknow on 1 January.
  3. Arshad posted a video confession on his social media account, which went viral.
  4. Arshad surrendered to the police, while his father is still absconding.
“We convinced them that death is the only way out and that we would also kill ourselves,” Arshad allegedly told investigators.

Conclusion: The motive behind the gruesome crime is still under investigation, with police looking into various angles, including allegations of harassment and land grabbing by neighbors. The public is shocked by the brutal incident, and authorities are working to apprehend the absconding father.
